      static int random​(int min, int max)
      Returns a random integer between min and max, following these rules: Min and max can be swapped around however you want, min doesnt have to be smaller than max If min == max, that value will be returned In other cases, a random value from the 'range' is returned: If min and max are positive (the normal case), the range includes the lowest value but not the highest If min and max are negative, the range includes the highest value (the value closest to 0), but excludes the lowest value (the most negative value) If one value of min and max is negative, and the other one is positive, both is excluded You may switch arguments, so min > max, then the highest one will be excl and the lowest will be incl If negative, the lowest (most negative) argument is excl, and the highest is incl

        title - The title of the prompt
        options - String[] with the buttons
        Returns:

      • random

        public static int random​(int max)
        Returns a random integer between 0 (incl) and max (excl)

        If max is negative, the same rule applies, including 0 and excluding max, which is negative

        Parameters:
        max - The integer above the largest possible integer to return
        Returns:
        int, the random number

      • random

        public static int random​(int min,
                         int max)
        Returns a random integer between min and max, following these rules:
        • Min and max can be swapped around however you want, min doesnt have to be smaller than max
        • If min == max, that value will be returned
        • In other cases, a random value from the 'range' is returned:
          • If min and max are positive (the normal case), the range includes the lowest value but not the highest
          • If min and max are negative, the range includes the highest value (the value closest to 0), but excludes the lowest value (the most negative value)
          • If one value of min and max is negative, and the other one is positive, both is excluded
        You may switch arguments, so min > max, then the highest one will be excl and the lowest will be incl If negative, the lowest (most negative) argument is excl, and the highest is incl
        Parameters:
        min - The smallest possible integer to return
        max - The integer above the largest possible integer to return
        Returns:
        int, the random number

      • average

        public static double average​(int[] array)
        Returns the average number in an array of integers
        Parameters:
        array - The array to get the average double
        Returns:
        The average in the array, as an double

      • average

        public static double average​(long[] array)
        Returns the average number in an array of longs
        Parameters:
        array - The array to get the average double from
        Returns:
        The average in the array, as an double

        public static boolean contains​(int[] array,
                               int target)
        Returns whenever an int is present in an array of ints
        Parameters:

        target - The target to search for
        Returns:
        True if there is at least one element matching target, otherwise false

                               java.lang.Object target)
        Returns whenever an object is present in an array of objects. Using object.equals(target object) method
        Parameters:
        array - The array to search
        target - The target to search for
        Returns:
        True if there is at least one element matching target, otherwise false
